get.description:
Get the user authentication token.
 
 This is a legacy version of the login request. Using GET is deprecated as your password is likely to appear in logs which record request URLs.
 Use the POST version instead.

parameters.description: the username of the user to get the token for
parameters.name: userName

parameters.description: the password for the user to get the token for
parameters.name: password

post.description: Get the user authentication token.

get.description: Get the list of projects that the authenticated user is entitled to access.

parameters.description:
if set to true, user data (e.g. allowedReviewers) which is expensive
 to compute, will not be included in the response data. Defaults to false so allowedReviewers are included in the response.
parameters.name: excludeAllowedReviewers

get.description: Returns a project description.

parameters.description: the key of a Crucible project.
parameters.name: key

get.description: Returns a list of all repositories. This includes plugin provided repositories

parameters.description:
filter repositories by the repository key, only repositories of keys containing this value
 would be returned if value was provided.  Case insensitive.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description:
filter repositories by enabled flag.  Only enabled/disabled repositories would be returned
 accordingly if value was provided.
parameters.name: enabled

parameters.description:
filter repositories by its availability.  Only available/unavailable repositories would be returned
 accordingly if value was provided.
parameters.name: available

parameters.description:
filter repositories by type.  Allowed values: cvs, svn, p4, git, hg, plugin (for light SCM repositories).
 Parameter can be specified more than once.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: maximum number of repositories to be returned.
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Lists the contents of the specified directory.

parameters.description: path to a directory. When path represents a file name, the result is unspecified.
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

get.description: Represents a particular changeset.

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

parameters.description: the SCM revision string.
parameters.name: revision

get.description: Represents a sorted list of changesets, newest first.

parameters.description: only return change sets after this change set. If omitted there is no restriction.
parameters.name: oldestCsid

parameters.description: include the change set with id "from" in the change sets returned.
parameters.name: includeOldest

parameters.description: only return change sets before this change set. If omitted there is no restriction.
parameters.name: newestCsid

parameters.description: include the change set with id "to" in the change sets returned.
parameters.name: includeNewest

parameters.description: return only the newest change sets, to a maximum of maxChangesets.
parameters.name: max

parameters.description:
only show change sets which contain at least one revision with a path under this path.
 Changesets with some revisions outside this path still include all revisions.
 i.e. Revisions outside the path are *not* excluded from the change set.
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

get.description:
Returns the raw content of the specified file revision as a binary
 stream. No attempt is made to identify the content type and no mime
 type is provided.

parameters.description: the path of a file.
parameters.name: path

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

parameters.description: the SCM revision string.
parameters.name: revision

get.description: Represents the history of a versioned entity.

the path of a file or versioned directory (note that

parameters.name: path

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

parameters.description: the SCM revision string.
parameters.name: revision

parameters.description: the key of the Crucible SCM plugin repository.
parameters.name: repository

parameters.description: only return reviews that are in these states.
parameters.name: state

get.description:
Retrieves all reviews that are in one of the the specified states. For each review all details are included (review items + comments). The
 wiki rendered comments will be available via the <messageAsHtml> element

parameters.description: the review states to match.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: reviews authored by this user.

comma-separated list of amy of the following strings: (Draft,
 Approval, Review, Summarize, Closed, Dead, Rejected, Unknown).

 retrieval operation and is provided for backward compatibility only.

get.description: Returns Crucible version information.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes the specified review.
 The review must have been abandoned.

get.description:
Get a single review by its permId (e.g. "CR-45").
 If the review does not exist, a 404 is returned.
 
 The moderator element may not exist if the review does not have a Moderator.

parameters.description: the permId of the review to delete (e.g. "CR-45").
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Get a list of the actions which the current user is allowed to perform
 on the review.

parameters.description: the permId of the a review (e.g. "CR-45").
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the perm id of the review to add the changeset to
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the review perma id to add the file
parameters.name: id

post.description: Old, non-restful name. Kept for backwards compatibility. Exactly the same as POSTing to /{id}/patch

parameters.description: the review perma id to close. it should be in the open state.
parameters.name: id

post.description: Closes the given review with the summary given.

get.description: Return all the comments visible to the requesting user for the review.

parameters.description:
indicate whether to render the wiki text in the returned comments. If set to "true", the comments will contain a
 <messageAsHtml> element containing the wiki rendered html.
parameters.name: render

parameters.description: the review perma-id
parameters.name: id

post.description: Add a general comment to the review.

parameters.description:
indicate whether to render the wiki text in the returned comments. If set to "true", the comments will contain a
 <messageAsHtml> element containing the wiki rendered html.
parameters.name: render

parameters.description: review perma-id
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the review perma-id (e.g. "CR-45").
parameters.name: id

post.description:
For the effective user, mark all comments in a review as read (except
 those marked as leave unread).

parameters.description:
indicate whether to render the wiki text in the returned comments. If set to "true", the comments will contain a
 <messageAsHtml> element containing the wiki rendered html.
parameters.name: render

parameters.description: review perma-id

get.description: Gets the given comment.

parameters.name: render

parameters.description: the perma id of the review
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the id of the comment
parameters.name: cId

parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the comment perma id
parameters.name: cId

parameters.description: the review perma id
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the comment perma id.
parameters.name: cId

post.description: Mark the given comment as read for the user used to make this POST.

post.description:
Adds the given review item to the review. This will always create a new review item, even if there is an existing
 one with the same data in the review (in which case the existing item will be replaced).

parameters.description: the id of the review (e.g. "CR-362").
parameters.name: id

post.description: Adds a review item for each of the supplied crucibleRevisionData elements.

put.description:
Sets the review item specified by itemId with the given reviewItem. The old review item is discarded. Can only
 perform this operation if the old review item specified by itemId can be deleted. The old review item's permId is
 not changed.

delete.description:
Removes the revisions given from the review item in the review specified by the id. If the review item has no
 more revisions left, it is automatically deleted.

parameters.description:
a list of revisions to add to the review item, merging if required. If a revision already exists
 in the given review item, then the given revision is ignored.
parameters.name: rev

parameters.description: the id of the review item (e.g. "CFR-5622").
parameters.name: riId

parameters.description: the id of the review (e.g. "CR-345").
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Adds the given list of revisions to the supplied review item, merging if required. For example, if the review
 item for  contains revisions 3 to 6, and if:

parameters.description: the review perma-id (e.g. "CR-45").
parameters.name: id
